meanings.definition: A fabric mesh woven from string or wire
meanings.sent1: The fisherman caught many fish in his net.
meanings.sent2: The basketball hoop has a net to catch the ball.
meanings.sent3: The butterfly got tangled in the net and couldn't escape.
meanings.sent4: The spider spun a delicate net to catch its prey.
meanings.sent5: The soccer goal has a white net that ripples in the wind.

meanings.definition: Remaining after all deductions have been made
meanings.sent1: After paying all the bills, she had a net income of $500.
meanings.sent2: The net weight of the package was 10 pounds.
meanings.sent3: He was left with a net profit of $100 after selling his old bike.
meanings.sent4: The net result of the experiment was a success.
meanings.sent5: The net amount in his bank account was enough to buy a new phone.

meanings.definition: A structure consisting of a framework covered with a mesh
meanings.sent1: The soccer goal is a net attached to two poles.
meanings.sent2: The hammock was made of a strong net that could hold two people.
meanings.sent3: The trampoline had a safety net around it to prevent falls.
meanings.sent4: The circus performer climbed the net to reach the top of the tent.
meanings.sent5: The cargo was secured with a net to keep it from shifting during transport.

meanings.definition: To catch or ensnare in a net
meanings.sent1: The fisherman tried to net the elusive trout in the river.
meanings.sent2: She managed to net a great deal on her online purchase.
meanings.sent3: The detective was able to net the criminal after a long chase.
meanings.sent4: The spider deftly netted the fly that landed on its web.
meanings.sent5: The basketball player attempted to net a three-point shot from the corner.
